title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 7904.4 - Contents of petition
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 7904.4 - Contents of petition

State Regulations
(a) A
petition seeking to appeal an order shall contain: (1)
the name, address and telephone number of
the appellant, and the appellant's attorney or other representative if
any; (2)
a copy of the order being
appealed; (3)
proof that the
petition has been served upon all other parties to whom the order being
appealed was addressed; and
(4)
a
clear, concise statement of the facts and law supporting the appellant's
position on the appeal. (b) A petition may include any other
information which the appellant believes will support its position. (c) A petition shall include a statement, signed and dated by the appellant, that all factual assertions in the petition
are true. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
7904.4

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
